alert.note: Alert for Central Plaquemines; Eastern Orleans; Lower Jefferson; Lower Plaquemines; Lower St. Bernard; St. Charles; Upper Jefferson; Upper Plaquemines; Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 10:59PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of St. Bernard, southeastern St. Charles, southern Orleans, northwestern Jefferson and northwestern Plaquemines Parishes through 1145 PM CDT... At 1059 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles southeast of Lake Catherine to 7 miles northwest of Shell Beach to Chalmette to near Metairie. Movement was south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Chalmette, Avondale, Marrero, Harvey, Timberlane, Belle Chasse, Metairie, Jefferson, Gretna, Harahan, Westwego, Jean Lafitte, Poydras, Estelle, Woodmere, Elmwood, Violet, Terrytown and Meraux. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 228 and 246. Interstate 510 between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 610 between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for southeastern Louisiana.
